InactivityTimer.name: InactivityTimer

eventTimeoutLength.description: Milliseconds of time when the timer is not listening for user activity after the user was active.

events.description: Events to listen to. These events will be attached to the element.

timeout.description: Milliseconds of user inactivity until user becomes inactive.

element.description: The element to attach event listeners to listen for user activity.

params.name: config
params.description: optional The configuration object containing the initial configuration values for the InactivityTimer.

constructors.description: Timer to determine if the user is active or inactive.

reset.description: Resets timer. Resets timeouts and fires 'onActive' event.

return.description: 'active' for and active user and 'inactive' for an inactive user.

getState.description: Returns the current state of the user

addEventBindings.description: Removes event binding from element then adds is back after config eventTimeoutLength.

stop.description: Stops the timer. Removes listening events on element and clears timeouts.

return.description: Time in ms since user status updated

timeSinceStatusChange.description: Returns passed time since user status updated. For 'active' state it is since the last user interaction. For 'inactive' state it is since the status changed to 'inactive'.

start.description: Starts the timer. Adds listening events to element and initiates timeouts. User goes to 'active'.

inactiveUser.description: Changes state to inactive and fires the 'onInactive' event.

initialize.description: Method run when class in initialized. Sets config options and adds state change observers.

addStateObservers.description: Adds the observers to track state changes.

options.description: The object that holds the default configuration.

timeout.description: Reference to timeout. Used to clear the timeout.

InactivityTimer.description: Timer to determine if the user is active or inactive.
